lead_paragraph: MEARS--DeAnn, 83 years old, died January 31, 2016. Ms. Mears spent her life in the theatre. She was well known for her leading roles in the American Conservatory Theatre, where she played in "Tiny Alice," "Tartuffe," and "The Royal Family" among others. On Broadway she appeared in "Abelard and Heloise" with Diana Rigg, "Tiny Alice," "Too Good to be True" (standing by for Lillian Gish) and "Showboat" at City Center in 1954. She also performed in "Dear Liar" at the Roundabout Theatre with Jerome Kilty, who wrote the play. She was known for her work in films, ("Presumed Innocent" and "The Loneliest Runner") and her television work on Beacon Hill. She appeared in many episodes of "Law and Order" and acted, sometimes along with her husband, Frank Savino, (who predeceased her) in many of the fine repertory theatres in the United States. She studied with Uta Hagen. She died at her home in New Milford, CT of complications of emphysema and COPD. She will be dearly missed by all who knew her. 1/3
